title: Usb c to 3.5mm dongle isn't connecting properly to new pixel 5. How can I fix this?
content:
The adapter in question works properly on a different Samsung device, and multiple online sources say the apple adapter is supposed to work well with pixel 5. 

When I connect the audio from what ever I am playing doesn't go through, and the connected speakers/headphones only receive a "clicking" noise. 

Other forums on line about a similar issue but for older devices, the posted solutions don't work, and no one mentioned the clicking noise.

The some of the solutions I have found is to boot in safe mode, and to clean the ports.

Booting in safe mode didn't work, and I bought the phone new less than a month ago, so there wouldn't be that much pocket lint or other debris in the usb port.
